description: Second and third floor extensions, external alterations and conversion of the upper floors over the retail shop into nine self-contained flats (Retrospective Application)
decision_conditions: The development hereby approved shall be retained in accordance with drawing title number(s) Site Location Plan Title No: NGL376451, Drawing refs: 9072/KING STREET - 2/4 - 901, 902, 903, 904, 905, 906 received 9th March 2012, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.   REASON: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning. | The provision of two 1100 litre bins in the refuse storage area shown on the submitted plans shall be made, this area shall be retained and used for refuse storage purposes associated with the development hereby approved and for no other purpose.   REASON: To safeguard the living and working conditions of neighbouring occupiers and in the interest of the environment, in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 3.5 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 2.10, 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 - Refuse and Recycling Facilities. | The flat roof area accessed via Block B, Flat 9 shall be accessed for maintainance purposes only and shall not be used to form a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area.  REASON: To safeguard the living conditions of the occupiers of the adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 7.1 and 7.4 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and Supplementary Planning Document 4 (Residential Extensions). | The 1.8m high obscurely glazed privacy screens, as shown on the third floor plan no. 9072/King Street -2/4- 904 shall be erected in the positions shown on that plan within three months from the date of this decision and permanently retained thereafter for the duration of the residential development hereby approved. REASON: To maintain and protect the residential amenities of the occupants of the flats and the occupants of neighbouring residential units in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 3.5 of the London Plan and policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
